definition[0]: if you retract something that you said or agreed, you say that you did not mean it
example[0]: He confessed to the murder but later retracted his statement.
definition[1]: if part of a machine or an animalâ€™s body retracts or is retracted, it moves back into the main part
example[1]: The sea otter can retract the claws on its front feet.
definition[2]: if a company retracts bonds, shares etc, it takes them off the market by buying them back from investors
example[2]: It will use its credit line to retract C$53.3 million in preferred shares.
definition[3]: to make an official statement saying that something you said earlier is not true
example[3]: A key witness hasretracted histestimony (=a statement in a law court) a year after the conviction.
